attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Colleagues of Sappers Patrick Azimkar, 21, and Mark Quinsey, 23, who were shot dead eight days ago, wanted to hold a special "ramp service" on board a RAF Hercules aircraft as final farewell to the dead soldiers. 

But the Ministry of Defence refused to allow the service to take place after claiming the soldiers were not killed on duty. 


Northern Ireland parade for Queen's Royal Hussars abandoned after murdersSources at the base said the MoD banned the service for "political" reasons after defence chiefs feared that any "overtly military" event would give the impression that Britain was still at "war" in Ulster.
